name: extemporary
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
done or said without any preparation or thought: She's an excellent public speaker who delivers concise, extemporary speeches. You need to plan your presentation, but make it sound extemporary. The surgeon did not perform any extemporary procedures during the operation. Synonyms
extemporaneous
extempore
impromptuRelated word
extemporarily
More examplesFewer examplesHe's a master of the art of extemporary public speaking.I can't give you an extemporary answer to your question.He prefers to pray in an extemporary way.I enjoyed listening to the child's extemporary singing.
